findings.title: Outdated Compiler Version
findings.description: The Solidity compiler version specified in the smart contract was outdated, which may potentially cause damage to the smart contracts or users due to publicly known inherent bugs.

findings.title: Inexplicit State Declaration
findings.description: The state variable visibility should be explicitly declared otherwise it will be internal. This improves the readability of the contract, allowing clear distinction on the scoping of these states.

findings.title: Arithmetic
findings.description: Values should be checked before performing arithmetic operations to prevent overflows and underflows, explicit conversion of types should be checked to prevent unexpected results, and integer division should not be done before multiplication to prevent loss of precision.

findings.title: Denial of Services
findings.description: State changing functions that loop over unbounded data structures should not be used.

findings.title: Best Practices
findings.description: The audit report highlights several best practices to follow in smart contract development, including error handling and logging, business logic implementation, blockchain data management, and external component usage.
